title: Introduction to excelerate
text: vignette demonstrates use excelerate package create supplementary tables example datasets. prepare CSV .cols metadata files, generate Excel spreadsheets.
code: library(excelerate)  # Set up temporary directory temp_dir <- tempdir()

title: Introduction to excelerate
text: First, load save example datasets CSV files. use built-datasets: iris, ChickWeight, ToothGrowth, CO2.
code: # Load example datasets dataset_names <- c("iris", "ChickWeight", "ToothGrowth", "CO2") for (dataset in dataset_names) {   data(list = dataset, package = "datasets") }  # Save datasets as CSV files for (dataset in dataset_names) {   write.csv(get(dataset), file = file.path(temp_dir, paste0("/", dataset, ".csv")), row.names = FALSE) }

title: Introduction to excelerate
text: create .cols sidecar metadata files dataset using create_meta() function. file contains column names descriptions ensure generated excel file easy understand.
code: create_meta(file_name = file.path(temp_dir, "iris.csv"),             table_variable_name = iris,             colname_descriptions = c("Sepal.Length" = "Length of the sepal in cm",                                       "Sepal.Width" = "Width of the sepal in cm",                                       "Petal.Length" = "Length of the petal in cm",                                       "Petal.Width" = "Width of the petal in cm",                                       "Species" = "Species of iris"))  create_meta(file_name = file.path(temp_dir, "ChickWeight.csv"),             table_variable_name = ChickWeight,             colname_descriptions = c("weight" = "Weight of the chick in grams",                                       "Time" = "Time in days",                                       "Chick" = "Chick identifier",                                       "Diet" = "Diet type"))  create_meta(file_name = file.path(temp_dir, "ToothGrowth.csv"),             table_variable_name = ToothGrowth,             colname_descriptions = c("len" = "Tooth length in mm",                                       "supp" = "Supplement type (VC or OJ)",                                       "dose" = "Dose of the supplement in mg"))  create_meta(file_name = file.path(temp_dir, "CO2.csv"),             table_variable_name = CO2,             colname_descriptions = c("Plant" = "Identifier for the plant",                                       "Type" = "Type of plant (Quebec or Mississippi)",                                       "Treatment" = "Treatment type (nonchilled or chilled)",                                       "conc" = "Concentration of CO2 in uL/L",                                       "uptake" = "CO2 uptake in mg"))

title: Introduction to excelerate
text: Next, demonstrate combine sheets single Excel file using sheet(), spreadsheet() excelerate() functions. example create two supplementary tables, containing multiple sheets metadata data example datasets. saved Excel files temporary directory names supplementary_table_1.xlsx supplementary_table_2.xlsx.
code: supplementary_table_1 <- spreadsheet(   sheet(temp_dir, "iris", "iris", "sheet_legend for the iris dataset."),   sheet(temp_dir, "ChickWeight", "ChickWeight", "sheet_legend for the ChickWeight dataset."),   title = "Supplementary Table 1. Example of output from excelerate(). This is the legend_title passed to spreadsheet().",   filename = file.path(temp_dir, "supplementary_table_1.xlsx")) #> File that match pattern:  #> /tmp/RtmpA4vW5U/iris.csv #> File that match pattern:  #> /tmp/RtmpA4vW5U/ChickWeight.csv  supplementary_table_2 <- spreadsheet(   sheet(temp_dir, "ToothGrowth", "ToothGrowth", "sheet_legend for the ToothGrowth dataset."),   sheet(temp_dir, "CO2", "CO2", "sheet_legend for the CO2 dataset."),   title = "Supplementary Table 2. Example of output from excelerate(). This is the legend_title passed to spreadsheet().",   filename = file.path(temp_dir, "supplementary_table_2.xlsx")) #> File that match pattern:  #> /tmp/RtmpA4vW5U/ToothGrowth.csv #> File that match pattern:  #> /tmp/RtmpA4vW5U/CO2.csv  # Save supplementary tables as .xlsx to temp_dir excelerate(supplementary_table_1,            supplementary_table_2) #> [[1]] #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 1

title: Introduction to excelerate
text: vignette demonstrated create supplementary tables using excelerate package R. prepared example datasets, created metadata files, generated Excel spreadsheets multiple sheets. excelerate package simplifies process creating well-structured documented Excel files data analysis reporting.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Amelia Edmondson-Stait. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Edmondson-Stait (2025). excelerate: Functions Create Export Excel Spreadsheets Supplementary Tables. R package version 0.1.0, https://ameliaes.github.io/excelerate/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {excelerate: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables},   author = {Amelia Edmondson-Stait},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://ameliaes.github.io/excelerate/}, }

what: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables
title: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables
text: package provides set functions easily create export Excel spreadsheets supplementary tables required preparing research manuscripts scientific journals. helps accelerate process generating well-organised, publication-ready tables directly raw csv tsv files.

title: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables
Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables
text: Prepare Data Files: Ensure data files CSV TSV format, accompanying .cols files metadata. Using function create_meta().

title: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables
text: example, mtcars (built-dataset R) saved mtcars.csv corresponding mtcars.csv.cols file look like : can generated using create_meta(): Generate Excel Files: Use sheet(), spreadsheet() excelerate() functions create save tables.
code: # Create metadata for mtcars dataset create_meta(file_name = "mtcars.csv",             table_variable_name = mtcars,             colname_descriptions =             c(             "mpg" = "Miles/(US) gallon",             "cyl" = "Number of cylinders",             "disp" = "Displacement (cu.in.)",             "hp" = "Gross horsepower",             "drat" = "Rear axle ratio",             "wt" = "Weight (1000 lbs)",             "qsec" = "1/4 mile time",             "vs" = "Engine (0 = V-shaped, 1 = straight)",             "am" = "Transmission (0 = automatic, 1 = manual)",             "gear" = "Number of forward gears",             "carb" = "Number of carburetors"              ))

title: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables
text: Please see Get Started page detailed instructions.
code: # Create spreadsheet specifying tables for each sheet supplementary_table <- spreadsheet(   title = "Supplementary Table Example",   filename = "path/to/save/example_table.xlsx",   sheet("path/to/data", "results_file_1", "Sheet name 1", "Sheet legend 1"),   sheet("path/to/data", "results_file_2", "Sheet name 2", "Sheet legend 2"),   sheet("path/to/data", "results_file_3", "Sheet name 3", "Sheet legend 3"), )  # Export to Excel excelerate(supplementary_table)

title: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables
text: output excel file multiple sheets. title specified spreadsheet(). sheet_legends, specified sheet(), sheet. meta data supplied .cols files sheet. remaining sheets supplied sheet(). order sheet object supplied spreadsheet(). sheet contains data corresponding csv tsv file, first row containing column names.

title: Create .cols Sidecar Metadata File — create_meta
text: function creates .cols sidecar metadata file column name descriptions given table. checks column names table described. .cols file saved directory data file, appending .cols original file name (e.g., your_file.csv.cols).

title: Create .cols Sidecar Metadata File — create_meta
Create .cols Sidecar Metadata File — create_meta
text: file_name character string specifying absolute path file name file metadata generated. table_variable_name data frame metadata generated. colname_descriptions named character vector names match column names table_variable_name values descriptions.

title: Create .cols Sidecar Metadata File — create_meta
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function performs file creation side effect.

title: Create .cols Sidecar Metadata File — create_meta
code: temp_dir <- tempdir() temp_file <- file.path(temp_dir, "example.csv") write.csv(mtcars, temp_file, row.names = FALSE)  create_meta(   file_name = temp_file,   table_variable_name = mtcars,   colname_descriptions = c(     "mpg" = "Miles/(US) gallon",     "cyl" = "Number of cylinders",     "disp" = "Displacement (cu.in.)",     "hp" = "Gross horsepower",     "drat" = "Rear axle ratio",     "wt" = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     "qsec" = "1/4 mile time",     "vs" = "Engine (0 = V-shaped, 1 = straight)",     "am" = "Transmission (0 = automatic, 1 = manual)",     "gear" = "Number of forward gears",     "carb" = "Number of carburetors"   ) )  # Clean up the temporary files unlink(c(temp_file, paste0(temp_file, ".cols")))

what: excelerate: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables — excelerate-package
title: excelerate: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables — excelerate-package
text: **excellerate** package provides set functions easily create export Excel spreadsheets, specifically generating supplementary tables required preparing research manuscripts scientific journals. allows quick customizable table creation R data, making easier structure format tables according journal requirements.

title: excelerate: Functions to Create and Export Excel Spreadsheets for Supplementary Tables — excelerate-package
text: Maintainer: Amelia Edmondson-Stait aedmond3@ed.ac.uk

what: Create and Save Excel Files with Supplementary Tables — excelerate
title: Create and Save Excel Files with Supplementary Tables — excelerate
text: function creates saves Excel files given spreadsheet objects.

title: Create and Save Excel Files with Supplementary Tables — excelerate
Create and Save Excel Files with Supplementary Tables — excelerate
text: ... One spreadsheet objects created spreadsheet().

title: Create and Save Excel Files with Supplementary Tables — excelerate
code: temp_dir <- tempdir() temp_file <- file.path(temp_dir, "example.csv") write.csv(mtcars, temp_file, row.names = FALSE) create_meta(   file_name = temp_file,   table_variable_name = mtcars,   colname_descriptions = c(     "mpg" = "Miles/(US) gallon",     "cyl" = "Number of cylinders",     "disp" = "Displacement (cu.in.)",     "hp" = "Gross horsepower",     "drat" = "Rear axle ratio",     "wt" = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     "qsec" = "1/4 mile time",     "vs" = "Engine (0 = V-shaped, 1 = straight)",     "am" = "Transmission (0 = automatic, 1 = manual)",     "gear" = "Number of forward gears",     "carb" = "Number of carburetors"   ) ) sheet1 <- sheet(temp_dir, "example\\.csv$", "Sheet A", "Legend A") #> File that match pattern:  #> /tmp/Rtmpdi8TDs/example.csv sheet2 <- sheet(temp_dir, "example\\.csv$", "Sheet B", "Legend B") #> File that match pattern:  #> /tmp/Rtmpdi8TDs/example.csv sp <- spreadsheet(   "Supplementary Table X",   file.path(temp_dir, "example.xlsx"),   sheet1, sheet2) excelerate(sp) #> [[1]] #> [1] 1 #>   # Clean up the temporary files unlink(c(temp_file,   paste0(temp_file, ".cols"),   paste0(temp_dir, "/example.xlsx")))

what: Read File Path, Pattern, Sheet Name, and Legend — sheet
title: Read File Path, Pattern, Sheet Name, and Legend — sheet
text: function reads file matching pattern given directory returns supplementary table data.

title: Read File Path, Pattern, Sheet Name, and Legend — sheet
Read File Path, Pattern, Sheet Name, and Legend — sheet
text: path character string specifying path directory containing files. pattern regular expression pattern filter files within directory. sheet_name character string naming sheet. sheet_legend character string containing table legend.

title: Read File Path, Pattern, Sheet Name, and Legend — sheet
text: named nested list containing main results (data frame), metadata (data frame), sheet legend. Named sheet_name.
